intro: Echinops nanus, commonly known as the dwarf globemallow, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a small, herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters. The plant features spiny, spherical seed heads that are characteristic of the Echinops genus. Its flowers are small and yellow, appearing in clusters at the base of the plant. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats.
